basics.name: Julio Cesar Fernandez Kolmer
basics.label: EEE Components Engineer | Physics Specialist
basics.summary: Physicist specialized in Electronics and Control Systems. Currently managing EEE parts reliability and product assurance for aerospace missions at Airbus Crisa. Expert in high-reliability components, autonomous robotics, and feedback control systems.

work.name: Airbus Crisa
work.summary: Managing EEE parts lifecycle for aerospace projects, focusing on reliability and product assurance.
highlights: Ensuring compliance with ECSS-Q-ST-60C aerospace standards.
Performing component selection, derating analysis, and Safe Operating Area (SOA) validation.
Managing Part Approval Documents (PADs) and coordinating quality tests (DPA, LAT).
Bridging the gap between theoretical physics and robust hardware implementation.

work.name: Robodin√°mica (UCM Robotics Association)
work.summary: Leading multidisciplinary teams in autonomous robotics and electronic design.
highlights: Designing custom PCBs and power distribution networks for autonomous platforms.
Implementing real-time control algorithms (PID) and sensor fusion for Eurobot competition.
Optimized navigation software achieving a 50% performance increase over previous human-controlled iterations.
Organizing technical outreach for the UCM Science Week.

work.name: Universidad Complutense de Madrid
work.summary: Collaborating in institutional decision-making and academic policy development.

projects.name: Eurobot Autonomous Robot
projects.summary: Full-stack development of an autonomous robot for international competition, featuring custom electronics and pathfinding.
